intro: Clinopodium syriacum, commonly known as Syrian oregano, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or blue. Its leaves are narrow, serrated, and emit a strong, pungent aroma when crushed. Clinopodium syriacum is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb, similar to oregano.
